alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 3:47PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN GRANT AND SOUTHEASTERN OWEN COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EST... At 347 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles south of Owenton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Owenton, Corinth, Monterey, Gratz, Stewartsville, Elk Lake, Beechwood, Cherry Grove, Natlee, Twin Bridges, Keefer, Camp Northward, New Columbus, Needmore, Elmer Davis Lake, Holbrook, Lawrenceville, and Cordova. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 152. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
